name: nor bandana
yarn_weight: any gauge - designed for any gauge
notes:
the gauge above is only a suggestion, your gauge may vary depending on what yarn and needles you want to use!


**nor bandana** is knitted top-down which means you cast on a few stitches and work the increases until you reach the desired length or run out of yarn. 
you can knit it in stockinette or garter stitch. with or without i-cord edges. it can be in any size you desire, small scarf, bandana, shawl or even a little blanket to keep you warm! if you’re looking for a quick project to knit for your pet, this is it as well.
it’s **a perfect scrappy project** to make space for new yarn in your stash, who doesn’t like it, right? 

**gauge:** any gauge
**needle size:** any needle size 
**yarn:** any yarn or any yarn combination

**techniques:** knitting flat, long-tail cast on method, increasing, bind off method, wet blocking.


**modification ideas:**

* you can color block or use intarsia if you have a colorful idea in your head
* if you want it to be a headscarf, you can add i-cord strings after binding off so that you can tie a knot 
* you can knit this bandana in garter stitch 
* you can knit textured stripes - alternating knit and purl rows on both right and wrong side
* you can add crochet borders or i-cord edges once your bandana is finished 
* you can embroider anything you like in the corner or all over your project
